titleStmt.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader, May 25, 1876

bibl.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States
Republic of Liberia

J Milton Turner
to the
Department of State
Washington U.S.A.
Transmitting statement of account for the quarter ended September 30, 1876.

No. 1. Statement of Account
" 2. Abstract of contingent expense
" 3. Voucher - loss by exchange
" 4. Voucher - postage account
New Richmond State of Ohio, December 7, 1876.

I have the honor to transmit herewith the accompanying papers making the statement of my account for the first quarter in the present fiscal year. Because of my necessity to crowd many duties into the time granted me for leave of absence, the return of this account has been somewhat delayed; which circumstance is regretted by me.

I have the honor to be
Sir:
With high consideration, and esteem,
Your obedient servant
J Milton Turner
div1.fw:
Honorable
John L. Cadwalader
Assistant Secretary of State
Washington U.S.A.
